0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Asthma; Diagnosis: nebulized, sequentially increasing concentrations of 0.03-10 mg/mL INHALED in 5 slow deep breaths, each separated by 3-5 minutes
  • Gastric histamine test: 0.0275 mg/kg histamine phosphate subQ
  • Gastric histamine test: augmented test, 0.04 mg/kg subQ following administration of a suitable dose of antihistamine

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Not FDA approved in children
  • Asthma; Diagnosis: 0.1-10 mg/mL INHALED, using the tidal breathing method.

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Positive skin test reaction, control
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Asthma; Diagnosis
  • Gastric histamine test

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• bronchial asthma
  • hypersensitivity to histamine products
  • hypotension
  • severe cardiac, pulmonary, or renal disease
  • severe hypertension
  • urticaria (past or present)
  • vasomotor instability

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Histamine: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Histamine: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Cardiovascular:Hypertension, Hypotension, Tachyarrhythmia
  • Dermatologic:Flushing
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea, Metallic taste, Stomach cramps
  • Neurologic:Headache
Serious
Respiratory:Stenosis of bronchus

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Histamine phosphate is a potent drug that causes relaxation and vasodilation of the blood vessels during an allergic reaction.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    the test should be read in 15 min
  • Intradermal
    • (skin test) administer at a maximum concentration of histamine base 0.1 mg/mL (histamine phosphate 0.275 mg/mL); or dilute ten-fold to 0.01 mg/mL of histamine base
    • (skin test) inject on the arm or back at the same site with the other skin test allergens
    • (percutaneous (prick, puncture, scratch test)) administer at concentration of histamine base 1 mg/mL (histamine phosphate 2.75 mg/mL)
    • (percutaneous (prick, puncture, scratch test)) inject on the back or the volar surface of the forearm at the same site with the other skin test allergens

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• size of erythema and/or wheal
  • blood pressure, respiratory function

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause hypertension, flushing, diarrhea, metallic taste, stomach cramps, or headache.
  • Patient should report signs/symptoms of tachyarrhythmia or hypotension.
